intro: Ouratea jansen-jacobsiae, commonly known as the Jansen-Jacobsia ouratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
